intro: Nothopanax ornatus, commonly known as the ornate nothopanax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several pairs of leaflets. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruits are berries that contain several seeds. Nothopanax ornatus is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
